chargeHist.descr: Sexual Assault of Child by Person Who Works or Volunteers with Children

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Hechimovich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Sex Assault of Student by School Staff, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(2).
  • Sex Assault of Student by School Staff, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(2).
  • Sex Assault of Student by School Staff, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 25% of the Defendant's income.
Shall register and comply with Sex Offender Registry.  Sex offender assessment and follow through and any other treatment as deemed necessary.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with anyone under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval.

Shall not have unmonitored computer use.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Shall submit to random urinalysis.

Shall obtain/maintain full time employment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam M Hechimovich in court with attorney Patrick H. Madden.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Madden heard on PSI, corrections; State objects; Court will not change; victim rights complied with; Court will start with Def. witnesses; Atty. Madden calls M.H., makes statement; Atty. Madden calls A.H., makes statement; no further for defense; State calls A.Z., makes statement; State calls Q.Z., makes statement; State heard re: restitution agreement of $8,363.01; Atty. Madden concurs; Court so orders restitution of $8,363.01; State argument; Atty. Madden argument; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

Count 1: Child Enticement
** 15 years in Wisconsin State Prison System - 4 years IC and 11 years ES

Count 2: Child Enticement
** 9 years in Prison - 4 years IC and 5 years ES - IMPOSED AND STAYED - 5 years PO cons. to Count 1 sentence

Count 13: Sexual Assault of Student by Staff
** 4 years Prison - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - IMPOSED AND STAYED - 3 years PO concurrent w/Count 2

Count 14: Sexual Assault of Student by Staff
** 4 years Prison - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - IMPOSED AND STAYED - 3 yeras PO concurrent w/Count 2 & 13

Count 15: Sexual Assault of Student by Staff
** 4 years Prison - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - IMPOSED AND STAYED - 3 years PO concurrent w/Count 2, 13 & 14

**NOT eligible for CIP or ERP

Conditions of ES:
* Register as Sex Offender
* Sex offender assessment and follow through
* Any other treatment deemed nec.
* CC each count
* DNA surcharge and sample
* Absolute sobriety
* Random urinalysis
* No contact with anyone under age of 18 without prior Agent approval
* Comply with Sex Offender Registry
* Shall not have unmonitored computer use
* Obtain/maintain full time employment
* Restitution of $8,363.01 to victim - to be paid out of inmate accounts - 25%
from State re rescheduling of sentence hearing
Sentencing hearing on December 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney James Sempf appears by phone means on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Patrick Madden appears by phone means on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Sempf heard, just rec'd 27 page sentencing memorandum w/quotes from report he is not in receipt of.  Atty Sempf does not have the opportunity to rebut or question the info contained in the report.  Requesting the report be excluded or adjournment of the sentencing hearing.  Atty Madden responds, does not want the report excluded.  Court reschedules sentencing, finds victim rights compliant based on Atty Sempf's representations.  Counsel to exchange any documents ASAP.
Sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam M Hechimovich in court with attorney Patrick H. Madden.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews recomm.; Def. to plead to Counts 1, 2, 13, 14 & 15 and State requests PSI; victim rights complied with; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. plead NC to all 5 charges; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Atty. Madden notes his reservations of Def.'s pleas to Counts 1 & 2, but Def. wants to proceed; parties stip. to facts/PH held; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Counts 1, 2, 13, 14 & 15 w/remaining counts D&RI; Court orders PSI; Sent. set; bond cont.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am. Court notes felony admonishments, no firearm, no contact w/children, other than incidental contact in the course of employment
Plea hearing on August 12, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea hearing on August 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam M Hechimovich in court with attorney Patrick H. Madden.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

Defendant Adam M Hechimovich in court with attorney Patrick H. Madden.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PH will proceed; State moves to close the courtroom other than victim and mother; Court orders courtroom cleared; State calls Det. Johnson, s/t; witness IDs Def.; witness excused; no further witnesses; Atty. Madden moves to dismiss; Court finds PC and binds over to Br. 1; ARGN set; motion to dismiss is denied

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with (victim) or Wayland Academy or any of its students; no unsupervised contact with minors.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:01 - Defendant Adam M Hechimovich in court with attorney Patrick H. Madden.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with (victim), Wayland Academy or any of it's students, no contact with any minors.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
